dialog.text: Hello. The seeker  is excited and happy. The supporter could tell the seeker to have fun and enjoy the moment.
Hey! How can I help?

Yeah... It's something about one of my long time friends. Well, she asked me to hang out and I refused her because of the pandemic. So, she now thinks I'm a selfish person and blocked me away. The seeker  feels unonsequential and blocks away from friends because of the pandemic. The supporter could tell the seeker to talk to her about it.
Oh no! That does not sound good.
beam_texts: Oh no! That does not sound good.

dialog.text: Yeah. I tried to explain to her that I wasn't doing it out of spite, but she didn't seem to get it. The seeker  feels unprofessional and selfish because of her friend's opinion. The supporter could tell the seeker to have a conversation with her about why she feels that way. The supporter could also ask the seeker to set up a time to talk about what is going on.

I think you are right. Sometimes people just don't get it. Maybe you should just do your job and do it well, and let her know that you did your best and it wasn't good enough. Do you think that might work?
beam_texts: I think you are right. Sometimes people just don't get it. Maybe you should just do your job and do it well, and let her know that you did your best and it wasn't good enough. Do you think that might work?

dialog.text: I think I'm going to try that. I really don't want this to be a big deal. We've been friends for so long. The seeker  feels like she is being selfish for not feeling interested in her friend. The supporter could help the seeker to say goodbye.
I think that might be the best thing to do. I hope it works out for you!
beam_texts: I think that might be the best thing to do. I hope it works out for you!

dialog.text: Thank you! The seeker  is feeling friendly and relieved. The supporter could tell the seeker that they are doing their job and are not feeling any pressure.
You're welcome!
Have a good day! The seeker  is happy to have good news. The supporter could say the seeker has a chance to try and do the job well.
You as well!
Thanks! The seeker  is looking for someone to help her with a friend and the supporter should offer to help.
You're welcome!

Have a nice day! The seeker  is happy to have connected with her friend. The supporter could say that the seeker has chosen to hang out with her friends instead of feeling any regret about not being able to spend more time with her friend.
You as well!

Thanks! The seeker  is happy to have new friends. The supporter could tell the seeker that she or he has time for new friends. The supporter could also ask the seeker to share more about getting to know someone new.
You're welcome!

Thanks! The seeker  is positive and grateful for support. The supporter could say that the seeker is going to try to overcome the anxiety of the exams. The supporter could also say that the seeker is getting support from professionals to help her overcome the anxiety of the exams.
You're welcome!
Thanks! The seeker  is positive and positive words are being spoken. The supporter could say that the seeker is going to try to forget the problem and that the words will make the seeker feel better.
You're welcome!
Thanks! The seeker  is helpful and greetings. The supporter could ask the seeker to think of other ways to help the seeker.
You're welcome!

Thanks! The seeker  is helpful and grateful for supporter's help. The supporter could say that the seeker is grateful for the supporter's help, and that the seeker is grateful for the supporter's help.
Thanks!
You're welcome! The seeker  is receiving help from the supporter. The supporter can help the seeker to feel welcomed and grateful.
Thanks!
You're welcome! The seeker  is using supporter for thank you. The supporter could say the seeker is welcome and thank you for being a supporter.
Thanks!

You're welcome! The seeker  is grateful for the supporter's help. The supporter could help the seeker to set up some greetings or reactions. The supporter could also remind the seeker to not be afraid to try new things.
Thanks!
You're welcome! The seeker  thanks the supporter for their help. The supporter could offer some tips on how to handle the situation better.
Thank you!
You're welcome! The seeker  is helpful andbefriendly. The supporter could say the seeker can now study without feeling any pressure.
Thank you!
You're welcome! The seeker  is grateful for the supporter's help. The supporter could say that the seeker is "one of" them and "one of the friends" of the supporter.
Thank you!
